category: Member Sports Organization Regulations/Article 19 (Chairman Election Organization)
contents: Article 19 (Chairman Election Organization) ① The Chairman is elected by the President Election Organization. ② Notwithstanding paragraph 1, member sports organizations for which the election of a president at a general meeting is inevitable due to special circumstances must undergo review and approval from the Sports Council, and the Sports Council must announce the results of the review accordingly. ③ The presidential election body under paragraph 1 shall be composed of not less than 100 but not more than 300 people, including delegates, players or former players (excluding coaches), coaches, referees, club members, etc. However, in the case of leaders, referees, and club members, executives and employees of the relevant member sports organizations are excluded. Revised December 26, 2022. ④ Article 24 of the Sports Association Articles of Incorporation shall apply mutatis mutandis to the personnel composition of the chairman election body of the member sports organizations pursuant to paragraph 3. [Full revision December 20, 2018]
